data.title: Flipped 9-patch fails
Fix for infinite recursion
data.body: The event listener's handle(event) was looping back on itself, causing StackOverflowError. This corrects the intention of the code, which is to call the outer handle(event).

data.title: jglfw snapshots
data.body: Why are no snapshots for jglfw backend in sonartype repository?

data.title: Update Threading chapter in wiki
data.body: The info about thread safety/not thread safety of framework's fundamental classes should be added here: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Threading.

data.title: Rendering simple frame takes too long
data.body:
Steps to reproduce a bug:

Create an empty libgdx project on version 0.9.9 or newer. Go to render() method and put at the top of it this code:
    if(Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTime() > 0.03) { //it can be different number, but it should be > 0.016. In my case even value 0.03 seems to work
        System.out.println("Long frame");
    }
It should never get called, because in order to have 60fps every frame should take at most 0.016s. And I assume that clean project which just renders an image should run 60fps with no problem... But it get's called every second on average. That means that every second something bad happens which slows down render loop.
I have tested it on couple different versions and it seems that it only occurs on libgdx 0.9.9 and newer. When I created 0.9.8 or 0.9.6 project everything was fine.
I also tested it on another computer and on my friend's computer and he confirmed. Problem occurs on Android too.

data.title: Pools class is not thread safe
data.body: In order not to add 'synchronized' for every method I have made typePools field local for all threads.

data.title: Various changes, mostly bullet related
data.body:
Dont look at the changes, its huge, instead check the individual commits
- Re-enable shadows for the bullet tests, use BaseBulletTest.shadows to enable/disable them. We might want to disable them for ios.
- Update to swig 2.0.12, nothing changed thats relevant to the wrapper.
- Update to bullet project to visual studio 2013 (still use vs2010 emulation)
- Add CharacterTest to show how to use btKinematicCharacterController
- Changed GL10 to GL20 in the swig interface
- PathTest was removed in https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/38e65331c71f092470a2c193adcbf2a75f05251d, added it back and updated it to gles20.

data.title: Getter for canvas element and LoadingListener in GWT
data.body:
I needed to get canvas to change it's width and height.
And I needed to do some stuff before the canvas element was added (beforeSetup()) and after the canvas element was added (afterSetup())

data.title: Why does the iOS Gradle project configuration have a wrapper task?
data.body:
Commit aee35c73707d3d410e7246f54952ff747d464b5f injects a Gradle wrapper generator into the iOS project:

```
task wrapper(type: Wrapper) {
    gradleVersion = '1.9'
}
```

Why was this done?

data.title: Second to last frame re-renders when pressing home on Android when Gdx.graphics.setContinuousRendering(false)
data.body: When Gdx.graphics.setContinuousRendering(false) is used on Android, pressing the home button causes the frame prior to the last frame to show causing artifacts. I am using scene2d.

data.title: GWT sendHttpRequest - no response
data.body:
The method Gdx.net.sendHttpRequest is not working as it will not call httpResultListener.handleHttpResponse even if the response is there.
Tried to implement it by myself and it is working. I can read response from handleHttpResponse in listener.

My quick test implementation:
![impl](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1550507/2351919/70cca9b6-a582-11e3-9d4d-7326daef3eb9.jpg)
![listener](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1550507/2351920/70d052c8-a582-11e3-80d3-afc4cefb4bc0.jpg)
![myresponse](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1550507/2351921/70d458fa-a582-11e3-8528-74a3b06b5c51.jpg)

data.title: Corrected abstraction and accessor methods
data.body: Also removed unused variables.  Previous pull request was #1441 but I've made sure to not use the enhanced for-loop due to GC issues (the things you learn!) :)

data.title: Removed unused variables that were just class noise.
data.body:
Made variables final that could be and would never change.  Removed double semi-colon.  Corrected abstraction in a couple of methods, corrected accessors on vars and methods.

Rewrote bits using the dirty for each method and made them easier to read where possible.

data.title: Gap bug in TexturePacker2
data.body:
Hey there,
I probably found a bug in the TexturePacker2 in libgdx version 0.9.9.
I have vertical gaps between two exactly aligned textures which you can see here.
![gap](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1345394/2345604/b955134e-a537-11e3-9822-8dfe7df1b62d.png)

Exactly the same code but with replaced gdx-tools.jar from libgdx version 0.9.8 gives me this:
![normal](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1345394/2345622/f331a596-a537-11e3-86ef-78734c718a67.png)
I just used the standard options like this:

``` Java
Settings settings = new Settings();
settings.maxWidth = 1024;
settings.maxHeight = 1024;
settings.debug = false;
TexturePacker2.process(settings, "/images", "../assets/images", "images.pack");
```

So it seems that there is a bug which has been introduced between these two releases! Or maybe the default settings for the TexturePacker have changed?
Changing the padding size doesn't change the result.

Regards

Edit: I used linear texture filtering in both cases.

data.title: Fixed AndroidFragmentApplication lifecycle issue
data.body: As suggested by the comments at https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1286 , moved clean-up to onDestroyView() lifecycle to prevent fragment from holding on to resources after it has been removed from the Activity.

data.title: Leak resource when download file on ios
SharedLibraryLoader: Fixed possible issue with upcoming Android ART introduction
data.body:
We currently check the VM name which is Dalvik, but in the future this vm name might change to ART or something similar as Dalvik is going to eventually be replaced. In order to make sure that applications do not break if such a change occurs, switching now might be the best option. That way if such a change occurs, which is highly likely, developers' games won't become broken if they are using a nightly that has the fix included.

THIS IS BACKWARDS COMPATIBLE WITH DALVIK-BASED DEVICES.

Per Android specification, java.runtime.name should equal, 'Android Runtime' regardless of Google's proprietary presence in the operating system. Even then, please test on your devices. I did some tests on mine and they loaded correctly.

data.title: Checkout issues on windows due to filename size
data.body:
When following the instructions https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Running-demos-%26-tests

If you try to check out the base url you'll hit the following problem...

``` shell
C:\Users\David\Documents\LibGdx OpenSource>git clone https://github.com/david99world/libgdx.git
Cloning into 'libgdx'...
remote: Counting objects: 126115, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (28915/28915), done.
remote: Total 126115 (delta 69673), reused 126114 (delta 69672)
Receiving objects: 100% (126115/126115), 736.94 MiB | 457.00 KiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (69673/69673), done.
Checking connectivity... done
error: unable to create file extensions/gdx-bullet/jni/swig-src/collision/com/badlogic/gdx/physics/b
ullet/collision/SWIGTYPE_p_f_r_btManifoldPoint_p_q_const__btCollisionObjectWrapper_int_int_p_q_const
__btCollisionObjectWrapper_int_int__bool.java (No such file or directory)
Checking out files: 100% (5592/5592), done.
fatal: unable to checkout working tree
warning: Clone succeeded, but checkout failed.
You can inspect what was checked out with 'git status'
and retry the checkout with 'git checkout -f HEAD'


C:\Users\David\Documents\LibGdx OpenSource>
```

Now this is just a standard fork I did of libgdx, now my question is, because this file name is so long, it won't allow you to checkout correctly and will miss files.

Is it the assumption that only parts of this project should be checked out?  I only ask as I'm curious if other people have had the same issue or if I'm overlooking the documentation.

Thanks

data.title: Hiero - adding outline to font while keeping the width same?
data.body:
I am trying to get a font like this
![f](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3469314/2318830/783dc162-a370-11e3-96ad-264d00d33d6c.png)
I added outline and then color effects and created it. However adding padding (so outlines are not cropped) makes the space between characters bigger. I can also set "padding x" to a negative value so they can get closer but this time it causes problems with centered texts. The string is shifted by that "x" value. 

How can I can adding padding to character bitmaps while keeping the actual size of character same? Currently I achieved this by increasing xAdvance of each character by same amount of x padding so each character is also shifted by same amount to right which balances it out.
